episode: With Easter coming up, I've found myself thinking about how we celebrated when I was a kid and it made me feel nostalgic.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: With Easter coming up, I found myself thinking about how we celebrated when I was a kid and how I loved dying eggs.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That sounds like such a fun tradition! Do you still dye eggs now?

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: With the price of eggs I don't think so!  When my daughter was still little we always did, though.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: I hear you, eggs are pricey now! At least you have those sweet memories with your daughter.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: When I was little we would always have to go to church before I could dig into my basket.  Of course like most kids the first thing I'd do is bite off the ears of the chocolate bunnies!

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That sounds like the perfect Easter morning! Those chocolate bunnies never stood a chance.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: And I remember picking the jelly beans out of the fake green grass that was in my basket.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Those fake grass hunts were the best! Jelly beans were like hidden treasures.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Those were the days!  Thinking about Easter, do other countries tend to have the same Easter traditions as we do in the US?

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Some do, but many have unique traditions too. It's cool to see the differences!

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I wonder who even came up with the concept of an Easter basket filled with candies.  It was probably some marketing ploy.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Yeah, probably some genius marketing scheme! But hey, it sure made Easter exciting for kids.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Absolutely.  And helped drive business to dentists.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Totally! Dentists probably love Easter too.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: My mother would make me a basket even as an adult, but now that she's passed I have to buy my own Easter treats.  I think of her quite a bit at holidays.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: I'm sure those memories bring warmth. It's nice to carry on her tradition.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: They sure do.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That's really special. Keeping her memory alive.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I don't miss having to get up early to go to church.  I'm not nostalgic for that.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: I get it, those early mornings were rough!
